characters: THAN AN INSTANT, IRENE SMILES AND WALKS AWAY. REBECCA CLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight pours through the window of an empty, silent dor room. The room seems alive, somehow. As if it's waiting patiently for this year's kids. A long beat. The room darkens for an instant. Just the su right, dipping behind a cloud? Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER CREDITS, we PAN DOWN a hallway full of COLLEGE KIDS. They carry boxes, stereo speakers, stand around chatting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARA MATTHEWS, 18, gets out of a taxi in front of a dorm. She's pretty, with optimistic eyes and brown hair cut jus above her shoulders. She's dressed casually, but still ch No parents. She carries a backpack on one shoulder, a duffle bag on t other, and a huge suitcase in her hand. And she's staring through the building's window at... Newly-minted COLLEGE STUDENTS milling about inside. Their parents in tow, pride and sadness mingled in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks to the registration table. A RESIDENT ASSISTAN smiles up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Sara Matthews. She looks her up in the computer. She plays with a simple silver chain around her neck. R.A. Des Moines, Iowa. Wow. Flyover country. She says it nicely, but it still stings. Sara smiles game R.A. You're in room three-sixteen. Welcome. She hands Sara a room key. She fingers it, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN ON Sara as she... Pushes an ancient, flat-bed cart out of the elevator and the hall, struggling to control its wobbly wheels. She bu into other carts, but everyone just laughs it off. Sara stops in front of Room 316.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door and looks in on: A run-of-the-mill freshman dorm room. Tiny; bathroom down hall; twin beds. Heaven. Sara steps in. She looks at the two empty beds. Big choic here. She drops her stuff on the bed by the window. She sits down on it. A beat. I'm really here. First things first -- Sara takes a framed picture out of duffle bag and sets it on the dresser. It's a picture of YOUNG GIRL, maybe ten. She looks a little like Sara. Sara hauls a white, Styrofoam DESIGN MANNEQUIN off the ca It's full of pin and chalk marks. She sets it by her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you we'd make it. She steps back to the doorway. As she hauls her suitcase the cart... BOOM! Another cart slams into hers. A box tum off the other cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! Bad driver. Sara kneels to help the other girl -- cute, frizzy hair - clean up the mess. A slew of clothes lie on the carpet. A peeking out from under them... a bottle of vodka. The gir smiles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case of emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara.
Balancing boxes, they manage to shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous fall day. Sara strolls across the quad, taking all in. Kids tossing frisbees... hacky-sacking... sunning the grass. Music pours out of speakers mounted in dorm windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara's cell phone buzzes. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Yeah, it's amazing here. I met this really cool biker? He's taking me to Mexico this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom. Just tell him I'm kidding. Sara stops in front of the campus coffee shop. She eyes a work/study ad on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's not here yet so I got to choose my side of the room. She tears a tab off the flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of Carnegie, a solid red-brick dorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara's half-settled in now. The wall beside her bed is peppered with fashion pages ripped out of Vogue and In St She sits in a lounge chair, paging through a Vanity Fair photo shoot. She spots a cool outfit and tears out the pa A KNOCK ON THE DOOR. Sara walks over. She opens it expectantly to see...
Tracy, Tracy's roommate KIM, and two other HALLMATES. All dressed to party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psi U.'s throwing a bash. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psi U.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a frat. Beer... guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I might just hang and wait for my roommate. Groans all around. "Come on"... "Lame-O"... Sara bites he lip, considering. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Just let me change. The girls cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of a proud frat house. Students piled o giant porch and there's a long line going up the steps to front door. Music blasts out of the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, Tracy, Kim and the others from the floor are at the head of the line, stepping into the house. They're met by FRAT BOUNCER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motions to a crowded keg) If you want beer, I'll need ID's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a frat party?! Seriously? He holds up a handful of ugly lime-green wristbands. Kim steps around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink anyway. Tracy looks at her, mouth agape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's punch and non-alcoholic beer over there... He points to a table with a giant bowl and cups. No one i around it. Tracy tries to flirt with the bouncer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, just us. We won't tell. The bouncer is tempted but not budging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, I'm just a pledge. They'll kick me out. She stomps by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuss. Defeated, Tracy walks over to the table. Turns back to Sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point? Tracy huffs as Sara walks into A SEA OF KIDS. We're talki extreme fire hazard... extreme moral hazard. Sara moves through the crowd. Her clothes are low-wattage but stylish. She's drawn to the music coming from a large room. A HIGH-ENERGY COLLEGE BAND on stage. They're not very goo but they don't care. Sara finds a spot along the wall and watches them. In particular -- THE DRUMMER. A cute goof, spastically whaling away. He's mouthing the lyrics, eyes closed. Really into it. Sara chuckles at the sight, not taking her eyes off him. He definitely stands out. Suddenly, a hand grabs her shoulder. Tracy pulls herself with Kim close behind and they start dancing to the band. Juice spilling over the brim of her cup. Sara stays by th wall, afraid of getting any spilled on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells over the music) Why aren't you dancing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not that bad. Tracy pulls Sara deeper in the crowd. Now all three start jumping up and down to the music. Sara's getting into it Tracy chugs her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DJ rules the room now. Sara and Kim are dancing with others from the floor. Sara notices a speck of punch on h shirt. She stops dancing. Wets her fingers and tries to r it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap. Kim still dances as Sara starts to look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Tracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was getting more punch. Sara then spots Tracy, with a full cup, precariously clim onto the stage next to the DJ's table with a bunch of oth girls already dancing. She starts dancing suggestively, egging on the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Guys yell out. "Show em." Several hands armed with camera phones stretch out above the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy. Tracy can't hear her. Sara starts making her way to the stage. Tracy is dancing, getting into it. She grabs the bottom of her shirt. Teases the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy. Don't. Sara slams into STEPHEN, 21, the DRUMMER from the band... inadvertently dumps his whole beer down her shirt. Sara gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! Sara's drenched as an enormous cheer erupts from the crow Camera phones clicking all at once. Sara looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Woops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go clean this up. She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like my plan backfired. Sara turns back towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To spill beer on you so I can start a conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spilled beer on me purposely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pissed? She looks at him. Pretty good looking. Goofy smile. It's hard to be mad at him. She then grabs a beer out of a dancing partier's hand and dumps it on Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get over it. He laughs, making her smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure how she's so wasted. All she's had is punch. Stephen grins conspiratorially and grabs her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen, now with a full beer watches as Sara sips some o the punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty good. She drinks some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't taste that strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. He takes a drink of his beer as Sara takes a long chug of hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen. By the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen and Sara are dancing. She's holding her cup. Drinking, bumping into a couple of people. Stephen laughs grabs her hand, pulling her back towards him and TWIRLS h bringing her close. She notices, for the first time, that he's not wearing a wristband and grabs his wrist with her other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why do you get to drink beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. My back is killing me. They don't move for a moment, Sara's resting her back aga his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, frat brothers don't have to wear those ugly wristbands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. You're in this frat? He jokingly untwirls her away and she bumps into people behind her. Sara laughs as she notices Kim, dancing, Holding up a cup of punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you try the punch? It's pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Tracy? Kim shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the worst roommate ever. Kim goes back to dancing Sara looks a little worried whic Stephen notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to look for your friend? Sara looks at him sweetly. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spot Tracy propped up against the railing at the bot of the stairs. Sara rushes over to her. A couple frat boy stand over her. Not sure what to do with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got her.
She struggles to hold Tracy up -- the girl's heavier than looks and Sara's balance is not so great, herself. The fr boys notice her struggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got you? Tracy nearly brings Sara down to the floor... But Stephen's there to catch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess that would be me. But then he stumbles, nearly dropping them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got you? Stephen looks at Tracy in one arm. The other arm around Sara's waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently God. Sara rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, Stephen, and Tracy stumble into the dorm lobby. Sar wears a jacket Stephen gave her for the walk. Kim and ANOTHER GIRL step forward and grab Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. They linger, smiling, checking out Stephen... They step i the elevator. Holding it for Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to wait? Sara turns and glares at Kim. An obvious "NO!" Kim lets t doors close as Sara turns back to Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm going to be pulling kitchen duty all week for helping girls leave a frat party. It's like opposite everything we stand for. Sara leans in and gives him a long kiss. Then separates, her lips still very close to his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low and romantic) Does that make it worth it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, no. She laughs out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to come up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than I can tell you, but that wouldn't be fair. Sara starts to take off Stephen's jacket. He stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it... till next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again. For everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, sorry about kitchen duty. He smiles... and walks away into the night. Sara looks af him... and now it's her turn to take a deep breath which suddenly makes her a little more queasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara heads for her room, holding onto the wall as she goe She reaches her door. She takes one more deep breath, the opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara closes the door behind her. Almost pitch black; just little moonlight through the window. Sara knocks into her lounge chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! She reaches her bed and plops down on her back. Breathing hard. Clenching her eyes shut. The room is spinning. She puke at any second. She struggles to sit up. She fumbles for the lamp next to bed, almost knocking it over. She hits the switch, reveal The other bed. Sara screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. FLASH. The girl takes her picture, further blinding and disorienting Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca. Your roommate. Sara calms, catching on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking your picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Rebecca shrugs. Sara grabs her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Her cheeks chipmunk as she rushes out the door. Rebecca smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara gingerly walks out of the bathroom back to her room, holding her head. The door is slightly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. Rebecca's covers are pulled up to her neck. He eyes are closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca? No answer. Sara makes it back to her bed. She falls onto and turns toward the wall. Rebecca's eyes open. And they stay open. She watches Sara to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the middle of the day and students carry their books everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara wakes. Headache; dry mouth; the works. The sun throu the window is way too bright. She slowly turns over to se Rebecca, up and about, arranging her side of the room. In light of day, we see that she's a knockout. Mellow music plays through top-of-the line speakers that flank an awesome stereo system. Rebecca sees that Sara's awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Sara. Sara stares at her blankly. Who is this girl? What happen last night? Rebecca smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We met last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... (racking her brain) Starts with a... "T"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close. Rebecca. She hands Sara a glass of water and two aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. It'll help, trust me. Sara washes down the aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Rebecca smiles, genuinely touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't throw up on you, did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You made it to the bathroom. Sara looks around the room. Her lounge chair has been mov to her side. Rebecca starts to tape drawings to the wall.. .They're va self-portraits of Rebecca. Sara looks at one where Rebecc is staring straight back at us. No smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you do those? Rebecca nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're really cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just like capturing my moods. A beat. Sara closes her eyes. Bits and pieces of the nigh before are coming back to her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca -- did you take my picture last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's just something I do. For my drawings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's hit the bookstore. The walk will help your head. Sara rolls over, groaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too damn early for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's three in the afternoon. Sara's eyes bug out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks along the back aisle, weighed down with textbo All look used and worn. Fashion Design. Psychology. Calcu She spots the last book she needs and reaches for it just another GIRL reaches too. They both pull back, neither su who has claim to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do? Sara looks her over. Checks out her outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice bag. Dior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sara snatches the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on financial aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara finds Rebecca by the art supplies, she's picking up stuff she needs. Sara scans Rebecca's books. They're all art books, shiny and new. Sara's phone rings. She looks at it: "JASON". She sighs. Her finger hovers over the "talk" button. A be She hits it right before it goes to voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I just wanted to hear your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to do this.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just making it harder.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sara, listen I... I want to come out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't come out here, remember. That's the problem. She says it too loud. Other students in line are eyeing h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta go. Sara hangs up. She exhales, flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That didn't sound good. Boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex. Off Rebecca's confused look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's complicated. A beat. Rebecca's warm smile makes Sara want to open up. They walk along the stacks of books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We dated since tenth grade and were supposed to go to college together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both applied to Brown. I got in; he got wait-listed. I stuck to our agreement and we both committed here. Then two weeks ago...a spot opened up at Brown ...and..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?! He took it? (Sara nods glumly) What an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you miss him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I know. But, you're in college now. A girl's gotta move on. Sara smiles, glad to find a kindred spirit. She looks at phone... and stuffs it into her pocket as they reach the register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca sits on her bed, drawing. Sara is putting her boo away on a shelf. As she reaches the end of it, she notice something out of the corner of her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?
Sara walks to the closet. Her modest clothes hang on one side. But the other side is now taken up by Rebecca's KIL COLLECTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... I've got a lot of clothes. Mind if I put some on your side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borrow anything you want. Really. I haven't worn half of them. Sara reverently fingers through them. Chloe. De La Renta. Alexander McQueen. Jimmy Choo shoes. A Miu Miu handbag. S still carry their price tags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, some of these I've only ever seen in Vogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents idea of bonding is to turn me loose in Beverly Hills with a Platinum card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pasadena. Off Sara's confused look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 20 minutes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cool. You can go home on weekends. Free laundry. Free meals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen. Sara gives her a puzzled stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story.. .Let's just say nothing's free in my house. She wants to know more... but it's too soon to pry. She n at Rebecca's drawing pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take a look? She walks over. Rebecca clutches the pad to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Sara stops dead in her tracks. Rebecca realizes that came across pretty harsh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not till it's done. Nothing personal. It's just my... process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't want to show you anything unless it was perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of a big college cafeteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Rebecca have just finished their dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were a design major. Why are you taking Calc and psychology? The girls get up with their trays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smirk) I am. I want to be well-rounded. (off her look) And they're requirements.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey Sara. Sara sees Tracy sitting by the window with Kim. Sara walk over, but Rebecca doesn't follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Tracy... Kim... this is my roommate, Rebecca. She turns, but Rebecca is standing at a distance. Sara wa her over. Rebecca comes, reluctantly. She flashes a small wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RRRRRREBECCA. How formal. What can we call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout Reba? Tracy sticks her finger down her throat. Gag me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Becca. Tracy's grimace vetoes that one, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout Becky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky's good. The girls all turn to Rebecca for approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Rebecca. Buzzkill.

dialogues.speaker: OOOKAAAY.
dialogues.text: Rebecca walks out. Sara shrugs at Tracy and Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara enters the Design building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara peeks in the open door of a classroom. Frustration i her eyes -- the class she couldn't get into. She watches PROFESSOR ROBERTS -- long-haired, dashing -- lecture his students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... here we are. Design 101. And each one of you is asking yourself the same question... (he taps his own chest) Who is this guy? Why should I turn off my Blackberry and pay attention to him? Mild laughter from the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you why -- because I hold the keys to the kingdom. Think of your favorite designers. Marc Jacobs. Vera Wang. Rick Owens. Magicians, right? I've got news for you: All of their magic stems from the same source: the fundamental principles of design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can teach you those principles. He lets the power of his words sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The journey to the catwalks of New York... Paris... Tokyo... starts right here, in this room. And all you have to do is open your minds. Man, she wants in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara stands by the door, watching the students file out. the last one leaves, she screws up her courage and walks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Roberts is gathering up his papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Roberts? He flashes a disarming smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to bother you, it's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I absolutely must take this class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we're full. But don't worry -- Intro Design has three other sections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not teaching them. I want to learn from the best. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara Matthews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought a request form. She holds it out to him. He takes the form, but his eyes on Sara. Roaming over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Sara -- why should I sign your request form when I've turned down a dozen others? Would that be fair? Sara's face falls. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I guess it wouldn't. Thanks anyway. She walks toward the door. Roberts' eyes go to her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said life was fair? You happen to have two things I can't teach... He walks to her... and hands her the signed form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Style. And Desire. He smiles, signs the form and hands it to Sara. Sara clut the form to her chest, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Rebecca sit on their respective beds. Rebecca listens to her Walkman. Sara types on her laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Rebecca removes her earbud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your Facebook page? I'll add you as a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a Facebook page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myspace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. I don't spend a lot of time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara stares at Rebecca. No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here. Rebecca walks over and looks at the computer over Sara's shoulder.
ON COMPUTER SCREEN: Sara's Facebook Page. Her picture in corner. Pictures and posts from a dozen friends. Among them: A STYLISH, ATTRACTIVE WOMAN in her 20s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene. She graduated from the Art Institute out here last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's an artist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A design apprentice for Marc Jacobs. Hey, check out these posts. Sara scrolls down Irene's recent posts: "Paris was amazing"... "Milan in the Fall"... "Off to Barcelona"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean.. .who doesn't have a Facebook page?! Rebecca laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I'll get one. Tracy knocks on the partially open front door... and marc right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancel those library plans. Guess who made the guest list at Rebar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys in? I trust you have fake IDs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do. Thanks to my badass self.
Tracy pulls out a fake ID. She walks to Rebecca and holds out to her. A peace offering. Rebecca stares at Tracy for a beat... then goes back to h sketchbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pass. Clubs really aren't my scene. Tracy stands there, hung out to dry, the ID in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A posh Los Angeles bar. Loud and packed to the gills with mostly young students. Sara and Tracy stand at the bar, getting jostled, looking like... two naive college kids. As they try to get the bartender's attention, older guys check them out, smiling and mouthing "Hi." Sara tries to ignore them, but Tracy's in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How great is this? No parents. No curfews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit! They clink their empty glasses in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I? She puts her wallet and cell phone into Tracy's purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad Rebecca blew us off. Talk about the life of the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just a little hard to get to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right...
As Tracy rolls her eyes... The BARTENDER sets two drinks down in front of them. He n down the bar at... TWO MIDDLE-AGED SUITS. Tracy flashes them a smile. Sara's so sure about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... Tracy raises her shot glass. She and Sara clink and drink Tracy waves at the suits again. Thanks guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do better. She takes Sara's hand and pulls her out onto the dance fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Tracy whirl in the hot mix of bodies. Having the time of their lives. A HANDSOME GUY moves in, his eyes on Tracy. Tracy loves it. They dance together as Sara watches, smil Tracy and the handsome guy drift further away from Sara. Sara is now dancing by herself. A GUY moves in on her, bu she politely dances away. She scans the dance floor for Tracy. Where'd she go? She steps off the dance floor and scans the bar -- no sig her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks into the crowded ladies' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bummed Sara walks out of the club alone. She rubs her a against the chill. She nervously tugs on her silver chain she scans the STRAGGLERS loitering outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy. She takes one last peek into the club doorway, hoping aga hope that Tracy will magically appear. No luck. She starts walking down the street, away from the club. Weary and unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca lies in bed, wide awake in the dark. Her cell pho rings. She stares at it. Two more rings. She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Would you accept a collect call from... Sara Matthews?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old school gas station on a barren corner of the city. cars in either direction. A lone white 328i BMW with a bl soft top sits next to an ancient pump. Rebecca, half asleep, climbs out and grabs the nozzle, sticking it in the fuel tank. Starts pumping.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can I help you out? She turns to see a 20-year-old, good-looking gas station attendant. His name tag: "Rick". Rebecca sizes him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Just in a hurry. She keeps pumping. Speeding it up. Rick ambles up to her, treading beyond appropriate personal space. He points to "Full Service" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just doing my job. She stands her ground as he places his hand over hers on gas pump and squeezes. She looks down at his hand on top hers. Then lets go of the pump, nudging his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done. She pulls the nozzle out of the tank and tries to place i back at the pump. He stops her. Motions to her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a little something. No, she doesn't. He, ever so gently, rubs his index finger and thumb on he cheek to remove the imaginary smudge until he lurches bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell? His crotch is wet as gasoline drips from the nozzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. But she does it again, holding the lever down, dousing hi head to toe. He scrambles backward out of range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry again. Rick. The nozzle's still in her hand, pouring gas in every direction. She opens her car door, grabbing a lighter. Rick's pissed. Charges towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spoiled c--- He spots the lighter in her hand. Dead stop. She absentmindedly flicks it. It sparks but doesn't light.

The gas is now pouring towards him. The meter on the pump still ticking up. He scrambles again as she casually flips the lighter at h and drops the still pouring nozzle. A hint of a grin and a pitying shake of her head as she p out a loose hundred dollar bill. Places it on top of the pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pussy. She gets into her car and drives off. Leaving Rick soaked gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara sits by herself in a booth by the window. Hugging a of hot, sobering coffee. Rebecca's car pulls up into a parking spot. The headlight shine right in Sara's eyes... and now turn off. Sara's tired eyes light up as she sees Rebecca get out of car. She waves. Rebecca doesn't wave back as she heads fo the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca walks up to Sara's booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where's Tracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea, I couldn't find her. Rebecca sits down, dropping her purse and keys on the tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as I'm here... you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starved. Sara smiles gratefully. Rebecca opens the menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe she ran out on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Thanks for coming. Rebecca looks up from the menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy had her shot tonight. Tomorrow you're all mine. I'll show you the big city.. .the right way. And I promise I won't abandon you. Deal? Sara smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca leads Sara through the sculpture room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the modern pieces. A little wilder than the old stuff. She's a savvy tour guide, confident, at ease. She doesn't just walk past pieces -- she studies them. Sara's impress Sara's cell phone buzzes. She checks the display: "Jason" She tilts it so that Rebecca can see and rolls her eyes. buries her cell phone in her purse. Sara spots a bizarre metal structure and walks over to it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I have no idea what this is supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even I don't get that one. Come on, I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca shows Sara into a room full of paintings. In the background is a banner announcing an upcoming Richard Pri exhibition.
They stop in front of Richard Prince's "Nurse of Greenmeadow." It's a portrait of a woman in a nurse's mas Her eyes peer directly at the viewer. Blood is smeared on smock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my favorite. Sara steps closer to examine it. Rebecca stays behind her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love how he captures her personality through her eyes. It's like she really wants to help you. Rebecca's hands tug anxiously at her shirt. She really wa Sara to like this painting. Sara moves even closer. She squints, trying to see what Rebecca sees. The woman's expression in the painting is actually pretty sinister. Sara's a little freaked out... but she turns to see Rebec hopeful expression. Sara brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing. I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Rebecca window shop along a block of thrift stor Sara spots a graffiti-laden wall next to a tattoo parlor. Some first-rate tagging here -- bright colors, funky shap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is so cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No graffiti in Des Moines?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. "Bobby loves Jenny. Chrissy loves Rick." Nothing like this. Rebecca pulls out her camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, smile. Sara poses... but now grabs Rebecca and pulls her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of us.
They both hold the camera, extended at arm's length. Rebe clicks. She looks at the picture. She can see the tattoo parlor in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's one "art form" I don't get. Needles into skin? No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a tattoo. Rebecca smiles. Yeah, right. But she can see in Sara's ey that she's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Sara pulls down her shirt and sweater a bit to reveal, ov her heart, a simple tattoo: "Emily".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My older sister. She died when I was nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pats her heart) This keeps her with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always wanted a sister. Sara smiles and interlocks her arm with Rebecca's as they walk down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara sits on her bed in sweats, typing on her laptop. Reb sits on her own bed, glancing over at Sara as she draws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who I'm listing as my favorite artist on my Facebook page?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Prince. Rebecca smiles, genuinely touched. She walks over to chec out the rest of Sara's Facebook Favorites. Favorite book, favorite band, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your favorite movie is "Coyote Ugly"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't laugh. It's about a small town girl making it in the big city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't every movie?! They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, in shorts and warm-up jacket, runs down the sidewal Her head's on a swivel, taking in the city sights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca takes down a few of her drawings. In their place, puts up a big "Coyote Ugly" poster. She straightens it ou Satisfied. She checks her watch and walks to the window. She looks o anxious for Sara to come home. She looks over at Sara's side of the room. Curious, she starts perusing her things. Books... CDs... She walks to Sara's dresser and picks up the picture of Emily. She tenderly brushes Emily's face with her thumb. She spots Sara's silver chain. She picks it up and places around her neck. She fingers it carefully and looks at herself in the mirror. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara finishes off her run strong, striding out the last t yards to the dorm. She catches her breath and hears a kit Sara looks in-between the columns outside the dorm and fi a STRAY KITTEN. She's cute as they come, a black-and-whit furball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there.
The kitten purrs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. She kneels and pets it. The kitten purrs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No collar, baby? Sara glances around to see if anyone is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara quickly walks in and closes the door. Rebecca sits i her windowsill, drawing. Sara sits down on her own bed. S notices the "Coyote Ugly" poster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd like it. Rebecca sees the moving bulge under Sara's jacket. She cu Sara a look. Sara sighs. Apprehensively, she unzips her jacket and the kitten pops out. Rebecca sits up. The kitt jumps over to her bed. She pets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. It's stupid, and I've just broken about forty different dorm rules, and I should just take it to a shelter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to name it? Sara's face lights up. She smiles gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be our secret. Just between us. Rebecca keeps petting the kitten. Getting more attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I named her in the elevator. Cuddles. She smiles and scoops her up. Suddenly, her smile vanishe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that my necklace? Rebecca touches it. She'd forgotten she still had it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I was just trying it on. Sara puts down the kitten and walks to Rebecca, who quick takes it off. Sara takes it back, annoyed. She rubs it protectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was my sister's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sara looks at it a moment longer. She looks at Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can borrow anything of mine. Except for this. Okay? It's the only thing I kept of hers. Rebecca nods. Sara sits down on the bed next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. You didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you two close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're the first roommate I've had since she died. So, it feels a little odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a good way or a bad way? Sara smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing of life at the quads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cool college hangout lined with old wooden tables and c couches. More like a living room than a coffee shop. Lots laid-back STUDENTS and... One stressed-out Sara, dropping drinks off at a table and rushing back to the register for the next order. Her CO- WORKER, clearly stoned, moves in slow motion. Not a care his world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted a mocha smoothie, right? O.K. Do you know what's in that? The kid shrugs. Sara hops to the blender and guesses some ingredients. She starts it up. She takes her hand off the lid, and... THE BLENDER EXPLODES, splashing mocha smoothie all over h apron. She's frozen in shock. The co-worker casually hand her a towel. She snatches it. She turns to find... STEPHEN, standing at the front of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This seems like a pattern. Sara smiles. She's psyched to see him, in spite of the ha She leans in and speaks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because I kissed you doesn't mean I'll let you cut in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does it mean?
She coyly shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the gentlemen of Psi Upsilon are reviving a sacred tradition tonight. Sara stares at him blankly. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're having another keg party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.. dunno. I'm still having flashbacks from the last one. Sara laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? How about if I use you as my excuse not to go. Sara smiles, bits of smoothie dripping from her apron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks off the elevator, still sky-high. She walks through the lounge, where Tracy sits on the couch. A television plays in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Sara thinks about ignoring her but stops. Her tone is col

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psi U. tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can ditch me again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara... the guy had a Porsche. And a hot tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your apology? Tracy jumps up and walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I meant to say is -- I'm sorry -- I totally screwed up. Down the hall, we see Rebecca open her door and peek out. watches Tracy and Sara. Tracy gives Sara sad, puppy dog eyes. Sara laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you. Tracy gives her a big, exaggerated hug. Over Sara's shoul she spots Rebecca looking at them. Tracy flashes a big sm Relief at making up with Sara. But that's not how Rebecca takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're on your own at Psi U. Because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone has a date. Rebecca hears this. She slips back into the room and clos the door. Sara turns and walks down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks in to find Rebecca slipping into a black dress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look... nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Richard Prince is having a showing. I bought two tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since he's your favorite artist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I... sort of have a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Major downer. Rebecca goes back to getting dressed. Heavy silence in the room. Sara watches her. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I could reschedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (being a martyr) You don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to. On one condition... Sara pulls a cute jacket from her closet and puts it on Rebecca. They both look at Rebecca in the mirror. Wow. Rebecca smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it, who's the designer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, a label whore?! Who cares ...I got it at a flea market and it looks great with the dress. Rebecca nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just needs one last touch... She grabs a pair of small, gold hoop earrings from her dresser. She places them in Rebecca's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna jump in the shower, then we'll head out. She grabs her stuff and hurries out the door. Rebecca eyes the earrings in her palm. She turns towards full-length mirror behind the door. As she leans into the mirror, we see that her ears aren't pierced. She takes one of the earrings and touches the pin against skin of her right lobe. After a moment of hesitation... SHE PUSHES THE PIN IN HARD. A small pop. She flinches. Bl trickles down her ear onto her neck. She wipes it off wit her thumb and touches the other hoop to her left ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Rebecca at the Richard Prince showing. The paint are all similar to the one we saw in the museum. A series women, peering at the viewer.

Rebecca wears her hair up, showing off her earrings. Ever guy in the room is checking out these two babes. But Rebecca's into the art, and Sara is texting Stephen. ON CELL PHONE: "sorry. next time : (" Rebecca notices and frowns. Sara puts the phone away and starts studying the paintings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's night and there's not a soul in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track slowly down the empty hallway, towards the door the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara sleeps peacefully. Cuddles lies on top of her, awake Her eyes glowing in the dark. Creepy. But not as creepy a Rebecca in the other bed. She's staring back at the kitte Envy in her eyes. Of Cuddles... or of Sara? Rebecca removes the covers and quietly gets out of bed. S walks over to Sara's bed... but not to pet Cuddles. She stands directly above Sara. Looking down at her. If Sara would simply open her eyes, she'd see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy is passed out in her bed. She stirs as she wakes. S reaches around her, slapping her end table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water. I need water. She stumbles to the mini-fridge and looks in: Empty. She groans. She grabs an empty cup... opens her door... And lets out a sharp little scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca sits right across from Tracy's door, her back aga the wall. Staring at Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca? What are you doing? Rebecca cocks her head at Tracy, as if she's trying to comprehend her. A beat. She stands... and walks to her. Tracy takes a step back, shaken by Rebecca's calm, morose demeanor. Rebecca stares right into her eyes. She makes a slight move towards Tracy, who flinches. Rebe turns and walks down to her room. At her door, she turns smiles. She disappears into her room. Tracy stands there, spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL VIEW of Sara and Rebecca walking to class. Tracy w ten yards behind them, waiting until... Rebecca and Sara wave "goodbye" to each other and head do different paths. Tracy hurries after Sara and catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How was the party? Are you still the beer bong queen? But Tracy's in no mood to joke. She pulls Sara to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... something is up with your roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was outside my room this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for me. I opened my door... and there she was. Just sitting there, staring. Like some psycho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's just... why would she do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask her? I've gotta go...I'll see ya later. Tracy stops and watches Sara as she continues on. Tracy turns to go the other way, but before she leaves her eyes catch Rebecca standing in front of a nearby building. Rebecca stares at Tracy much like she did in the hallway. Tracy leaves in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara sits in her Design class. Professor Roberts stands a the podium. Three white design mannequins behind him, eac sporting a different fashion style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contrary to popular opinion, beauty is not in the eye of the beholder. It's in the hands of the designer. Sara listens intently, soaking it all in. Her cell buzzes with a text message. She discreetly takes a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who can tell me the difference between fashion and style? FROM IRENE: "4th & ford. be there now." Sara smiles a message. Professor Roberts notices Sara looking at her cell phone calls on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Matthews? Without missing a beat, Sara replies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fashion's something you can buy, but style you either have or you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. All the money in the world can't buy you style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it can buy you a good stylist. The class chuckles. Professor Roberts smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara comes out of the building, texting on her cell as sh walks. Rebecca is waiting, holding two cups of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How'd you know when my class got out? Rebecca shrugs, playing it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your roommate. Sara smiles and grabs a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the quads. Other students are around, s strolling leisurely, others rushing to get to class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... Tracy told me something kinda weird. She says you... scared her this morning. Rebecca stops and looks at Sara. She starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more like she scared me. She was racing to the bathroom like she was gonna hurl. She almost knocked me over. A beat as Sara ponders it all. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl does like to party. Anyway, I wouldn't worry about it. Rebecca takes a victory sip as Sara gets another text fro Irene: "where r u?!?!?!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go meet Irene. (raises her cup) Thanks for the coffee. Rebecca watches her walk off. She takes another sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara gets out of a cab. She looks up at a big building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks through a design studio. Models and make-up artists are rushing around, dragging thousands of dollars worth of dresses. Sara loves the place's chaotic energy. She knocks on an open door and sees a YOUNG MODEL being worked on by a designer who isn't much older. IRENE, 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full of pins) Finally. She gets up to hug Sara. Nearly tearing the dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene is putting a dress together on a MODEL. Sara watche awe. An OLDER DESIGNER walks by... checks on Irene's work nods his approval... and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I so want to be you when I grow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I wanna be me when I grow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to be a star. Irene rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, your dad left me four messages last week. Making sure I'm looking out for his baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god. I hope you told him I'm closing down the library every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him I haven't seen you. And that for all I know you're a crack ho by now. Even the model laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks along, looking for a table. She spots Stephen sitting by himself. Drumming on his leg with a pencil. Ignoring the open textbook in front of him. She sits down across from him. They both smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen you around too much since you blew me off for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry again. Actually, how about dinner tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellllo. I'm studying. She takes his book. He's on page two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page two? Busted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's really dense. Off Sara's smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim exits the bathroom and passes Tracy coming the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it goin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Tracy, wearing just a towel, and brushing her teeth as sh walks, steps into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hums to herself as she spits out the toothpaste. She removes the towel and steps into the shower, pulling curtain closed. As she shampoos her hair... The lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be kidding me. Hey! The only light is some distorted moonlight through the window. Tracy steps out of the shower, grabbing her towel Just as she starts to feel her way along the wall... The lights come back on. She sighs happily... sheds her towel... and steps back under the steaming water. A beat. The lights go off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit ! She turns off the shower. A beat of silence, but now... o of the other showers turns on. What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how about turning on the light?
No response. Yet another shower turns on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's out there? Tracy, back in her towel, nervous now, feels her way alon the wall again. She turns on the lights. The curtains are drawn in front of both running showers. Tracy stares at them. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's you. She walks over to the shower. A beat. She rips away one curtain. Nothing behind it but the running shower. She tu it off. She stares at the other curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara thinks you're weird. She told me. She pulls back the other curtain... nothing. She turns of that shower, too. But she can still hear running water. She looks back. The curtain from her own shower is closed again. The sound of running water behind it. She walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not funny, Rebecca. (under her breath) Bitch. She grips the curtain. She steels herself. She yanks the curtain open to see... Just running water. Tracy shakes her head. She looks arou no one. She slips her towel off and slips back under the water. Screw Rebecca -- she's going to finish this shower

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak. Just as the warm water starts to relax her... THE SHOWER CURTAIN CRASHES OVER HER, pile-driven by Rebec The curtain comes right off the rings. Tracy is slammed against the shower wall. She hits the fl hard, with Rebecca on top of her. Water pelting them both
Rebecca clamps a hand over Tracy's mouth and pins her aga the wall. The shower curtain covers her from the neck dow Tracy -- wide-eyed and terrified -- stares at Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Sara thinks I'm weird? Let me tell you what I think. I think you're a little whore, and a bad influence on her. And I think that if you tell anyone about... what I'm about to do... you'll regret it. Rebecca, one hand still on Tracy's mouth, slides her othe hand beneath the shower curtain. Tracy's eyes widen furth Rebecca finds what she's looking for... gets the grip she needs... and violently jerks her hand out of the curtain. A muffled scream from Tracy. Tears stream down her face. Rebecca stands. As Tracy sobs quietly on the shower floor Rebecca looks down at... The bloody ring in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice belly ring. She tosses it to Tracy... and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Stephen are sitting on a couch. His arm around h shoulder, lightly playing with the ends of her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to flunk my test tomorrow, thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's make sure it was worth it. She gives him a slow, lingering kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh, joke's on you. I was going to flunk anyway. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca sits on her bed, petting Cuddles, blood still on fingers, humming the tune that Tracy was humming in the bathroom. She hears steps and voices in the hallway. She smiles -- must be Sara. She quickly turns off the light and pretends to sleep. Bu the steps pass her door and keep going. Not Sara. She turns on the light. Worry in her eyes. She picks up h cell phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Stephen step off the elevator. Time to say goodb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for helping me... not study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime. He kisses her. Sweet and tender. Until... Sara sees Rebec Standing just five feet away. Staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kept calling and calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I turned my cell off at the library and forgot to turn it back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca... this is Stephen. He flashes a smile. Rebecca doesn't even look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bed now. I'm glad you're okay. She walks out of the lounge. A beat. That was awkward. Sa bites her lip, as if to say: "What can you do?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a curfew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she's right...I shoulda called. He smiles -- no big deal. He kisses her and steps into th elevator. They look at each other, waiting for the ancien doors to close. Stephen steps forward and sneaks in one m kiss. The doors close. Sara smiles; what a night. She glances down toward her do and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Rebecca walk in silence, sipping their coffees. Rebecca looks straight ahead, listening to her Walkman. A they reach the fork in the path...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'll see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night. I was just worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to worry about me. I can take care of myself. Okay? Rebecca slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara. We're good, right? A beat. Sara nods and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Stephen at a table, books spread around them. Stephen is reading Rolling Stone. Sara's on her laptop, checking her Facebook page. She get message for adding a new friend... from Rebecca. She clic to add her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca sits in a chair on the other side of the library. Unbeknownst to Sara and Stephen, Rebecca watches them thr the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara clicks onto Rebecca's Facebook page. She's listed on one friend: Sara. She's posted the picture of her and Sar front of the graffiti wall. And some of her drawings. And picture of a pretty brunette teenager, captioned "Maria." Sara looks at Rebecca's interests. Favorite Artist: Richa Prince. Favorite Passion: Drawing. Favorite movie: Coyote Ugly. Sara smiles. Best Friend: SARA. Her smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already her best friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a little sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. But the look on her face says she agrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she REALLY likes you...if you know what I mean. She looks at him quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. He just looks at her, raising his eyebrows suggestively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... are...a...moron. He grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca watches Stephen kiss Sara, her expression is toug read. Is she jealous... or entranced? Sara gets up and leaves. Stephen goes to the stacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen, alone, searches for a book among the remote stac The stacks are massive and endless -- row after row of th Stephen thumbs through books, not finding the one he need He drops a book and bends down to pick it up. Over his shoulder, we see... REBECCA'S EYES in the space between the shelves. She's in next aisle over. Stephen replaces the book. He walks down the aisle, looki at the numbers of the books. Rebecca mimics his pacing as she follows him down her ais Her hands gently brush against the books, her eyes on Stephen. He turns in her direction and stops in his track So does Rebecca. She's completely still. Stephen walks over. He puts his hand on the book that cov Rebecca. He's about to pull it out and reveal her. But it not the right one. He keeps walking. He reaches the end of his aisle... and Rebecca the end of hers. She's right around the corner from him. He reads th markers at the end of the aisle, trying to figure out whi direction to go. Rebecca's hands are sweaty. She's nervous. Does she want get caught? Stephen turns right, away from her, and start down the next aisle. Rebecca softly exhales. And now whispers to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen. Stephen stops dead. Did he hear something? Guess not. He keeps going, scanning the book numbers again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, wrong aisle. He doubles back, and turns into Rebecca's aisle. But it's EMPTY. We hear a door close in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen and Sara walk on a tree-lined path. Holding hands checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we head back home? They walk by a small playground comprised of the slide, jungle gym, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is "whose home?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make you a bet. I go back to your place or you take me home to my twin bed and roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the bet? She eyes the jungle gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Stephen are each hanging from the jungle gym. Th has been going on for a few minutes. Both straining. Stephen's worse off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is kind of a stupid bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, I'm kind of a stupid guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making me laugh isn't going to help you. They stare each other down. She's stifling a laugh, much more in control as Stephen is straining.
He tries to swing his legs and kick her. She avoids him. catches a peek at her bare midriff. Finally, this makes h fall. She then lets go, victorious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a gymnast until I hit a growth spurt my freshman year. Stephen brushes himself off. Dejected that he was "this close". She walks up to him. Cocky. Gives him a playful shove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I win. He gives her a playful shove back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. She seductively walks back towards him. Takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...let's go back to your place. She gives him a seductive grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca sketches in her bed. She looks at the clock: 1:00 a.m. And no Sara. History is repeating itself.. .and Rebe pissed. She rips out her sketch page and throws it away. She starts pacing the floor. She angrily moves Sara's cha back to her side. She whips out her phone and eyes the di button. She starts to dial... but kills the call. She picks up her sketchpad again. Suddenly: A BUZZING SOUND from Sara's desk. Rebecca pulls out the d drawer and finds Sara's cell phone. On the call screen: "JASON". A long beat. She pushes the talk button... but just liste

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm?

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sara, you answered. Thank you. Can we talk... about us? Rebecca's eyes clear. She's in control again. She sits do on Sara's bed, tossing Cuddles roughly to the floor. And she lies down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you. She moves her hand across her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you, Jason.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I.. . want you, too. But... Rebecca's hand moves toward her panties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss touching you. Do you miss touching me?

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Like you wouldn't believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Stephen slam along the walls, in a fever. Kissin madly, missing each other's mouths. At his door... he cra it open and peeks inside. His room is a disaster. Definitely a new world record for empty beer cans, pizza boxes, and strewn clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.
But he slips into the room and closes the door behind him Sara leans back against the wall. Flushed, breathing hard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen is a whirlwind. He tosses everything -- beer cans clothes, study papers -- into one big garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there.

dialogues.speaker: SARA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (through the door) I'm going to start taking my clothes off out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. He's not quite buying it... but he's cleaning faster.

dialogues.speaker: SARA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oops! There goes my shirt... She's got his attention now. He speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, goddamnit, that's supposed to be my strip tease.

dialogues.speaker: SARA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: There go the jeans. He's popping breath mints... while clearing off his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just going to put your clothes back on and make you strip again.

dialogues.speaker: SARA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hmmm. What's next? Top or bottom? Stephen stops and stares at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara stands there, fully dressed. She looks down the empt hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do we have here? Hey guys! Let me ask you. Bra or panties? Bra? Okay, okay. Just calm down. The door swings open. Stephen stands in front of her, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you didn't have the guts. She flicks her bra at his face. He catches it, shocked. H tosses it aside and yanks her into the room. The door sla shut behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca is breathing harder and faster now. Still holding phone, from which we hear Jason's moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say my name, Jason. Until I tell you to stop. She puts the phone on speaker and lays it on the pillow beside her. Both her hands ease back under the covers.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sara... Sara... Sara... Rebecca writhes, eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Stephen make out in bed, half-naked. He lies on of her. Looking into her eyes. Sweet and intimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca writhes and moans.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sara... Sara... They moan together. Louder and louder... and now they fin A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (catching his breath) Jesus, Sara. That was incredible. Rebecca smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I miss you so much. Her smile dies. She picks up the phone. A cruel gleam in eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever call me again. She kills the call. And now deletes it from the phone log

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie Dorm on a bright, clear morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, hair mussed up but eyes shining. Sara opens her doo and steps in. She's tentative, expecting Rebecca to jump her throat. But Rebecca smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Sorry I didn't call. I forgot my phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. Sara opens her desk drawer and grabs her phone. She quick checks. No calls. Rebecca looks Sara over and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...don't I get any details??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice girl doesn't kiss and tell. They laugh. A nice, easy vibe between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go get some breakfa-- Before she can finish, Cuddles bolts out the door and dow the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. Sara chases after her as Rebecca gets up from her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara turns the corner to see... The resident assistant, with Cuddles cradled in her arms. Sara apprehensively walks up to him. R.A. Is this your cat, Sara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... R.A. She's cute... She nods as she gingerly takes Cuddles from his arms. She turns to walk back to the room. R.A. And if you keep her, I lose my job. Do we understand each other? She stops. Turns. Looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Sara walks back to her room. Rebecca stands in the doorwa They exchange despondent looks. Screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene opens the door and Sara walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ten bucks for a cab and I'm a student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara! You can't just walk around downtown L.A. at night. This is not Des Moines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, listen to me. That's why I own a gun. Sara's shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely! Big cities are crawling with crazies. Sara moves into the apartment. Her phone rings. She answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Oh, Hi. Yeah, I'm over at Irene's. I meant to leave you a note. Uh huh, uh huh, oh! That's a good idea. Let me check, hold on. Sara covers the phone and turns to Irene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like cats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get rid of one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't. Travel too much. Poor thing would starve to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. (back into phone) No, she can't. Huh? Oh I don't know... whenever I get there. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My roommate. More than a little overprotective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you had a surprise for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. I went through my closet. There's nothing here I've worn in the past six months. Irene walks toward the couch where there's a pile of clot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding, all of these?! Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ...what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no closet space at the dorms. Rebecca's already using half of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, I just had the best idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you move in here with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm never here. The place is huge. Ditch the roommate. And, the building allows pets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Let me talk to Rebecca about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how's Jason? I really liked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We broke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ...he sucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara stuffs her new clothes into her tiny closet. The bag spill out into the room, taking up floor space. Rebecca sits on her bed, her laptop open. She's staring a Irene's Facebook Profile. There are some racy pictures of Irene and some girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What're those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene gave them to me. She had a lot more but we don't have the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad she couldn't take Cuddles, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe that's not a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She actually suggested that I move in with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
