dialogues.text: No, of course not. I love living here... with you. Sara smiles as she sits down next to Rebecca, trying to p bright spin on things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'd still technically be living here. So you wouldn't have to get a new roommate. Her place is huge and it's not like you couldn't use the extra closet space. I'd just move some of my stuff over, and spend a few nights a week there. We'd both have a lot more space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want more space. I want... She checks herself. A beat of awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's set in stone. It's just something to think about. Plus we'd be able to keep Cuddles. As Sara hangs more new clothes in her closet, Rebecca sta across the room at... Cuddles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sara crosses the quads, she spots Tracy up ahead, walk by herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy! Tracy slows for a split-second, then keeps walking. As if didn't hear anything. Sara hurries to catch up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy... hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. Tracy smiles, but weakly. The girl's lost all her sparkle Her eyes dart around nervously, like a bird's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you changed dorms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Conrad Hall. Seemed like a better vibe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we should get together. Like grab a bite or something. Right?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sara! Sara turns and waves at Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Rebecca starts to walk over to Tracy and Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you. But she's already walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She just walked away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she's always been a flake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara whips up a latte for a customer, her cell phone to h ear. She's really got the hang of this job now. In charge moving with a purpose. She snatches an issue of High Times from her co-worker's and points him toward the sink. He starts washing blender

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I do so call, Mom. Geez. Her latte customer rolls his eyes. Moms. He takes his dri and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually, I was thinking I'd do Thanksgiving here and see you guys for Christmas. She listens, her face telling us that she doesn't like wh she's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know what, I'm at work, and I'm really getting slammed... There isn't another customer in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you later, okay? Tell Dad I said hello. Bye. She hangs up the phone and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca gathers her laundry into a giant duffle bag. As s carries it toward the door, she passes Cuddles, curled up Sara's bed. She scoops her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it's just you and me tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca walks downstairs, down the hallway to the laundry room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca waits for her clothes to finish drying. Cuddles p with a sock on top of a nearby washer. Rebecca checks on her clothes. They're dry, with two minu still left on the timer. She stuffs the clothes into her duffle bag. She walks to the washers and picks up Cuddles She pets her gently. She walks back to the dryer and places Cuddles inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how nice and warm it is in there? Cuddles seems to enjoy the warmth. Rebecca closes the doo and watches the confused kitten paw at the glass. She gently pushes the start button, just enough to get th dryer moving for a sec. Cuddles stumbles, falls over, and gets back up. Rebecca pushes the button again, a little longer this tim Cuddles stumbles. Flips over. The dryer beeps. OUT OF TIME. Cuddles meows at Rebecca, wanting out. She reaches into her pocket... and pulls out last quarter. She gently places it in the slot. ON DRYER DISPLAY: 15 MINUTES. Rebecca stares through the glass at the kitten. She fingers the button. Before she pushes it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks in to find Rebecca sprawled on her bed, crying She rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's wrong? Rebecca looks up at her, eyes red. Ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuddles got out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. In the dorm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was doing laundry... I took her with me... She jumped out of the bag and ran outside. I went after her, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Sara stands, pissed. She wants to really go off on Rebecc but the girl's so distraught, so fragile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she'll come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to help? But Sara's already gone, slamming the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Rebecca sit alone at a table. Eating quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's... just karma or something. We weren't allowed to keep her anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... stress after stress, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something else wrong? A beat as Sara decides whether to confide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents really want me to come home for Thanksgiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not exactly the most festive holiday in the Matthews household.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily died two days before Thanksgiving. A beat. Rebecca pats Sara's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I should be there with them, but it's like there's a ghost at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Rebecca sits up, her excitement growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, spend Thanksgiving at my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your folks wouldn't mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Like they'd even notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll see. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Roberts stands at the blackboard, wrapping up a lecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your midterm designs are due Friday. Remember, class: Simplicity. Who founded our industry? Eve -- when she handed Adam that fig leaf. Students laugh on their way out the door. As Sara walks p Roberts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara. Could I see you in my office, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I've got a class right now. But I'll come right after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara knocks on Professor Roberts' open door. She steps in his office. It's small and intimate, with books stacked a every wall. Scraps of fabric are pinned to cork boards. Roberts smiles at her from his chair. He walks to the doo and closes it. He walks back, pulls a chair close to hers and sits down. She crosses her legs, her knees accidental brushing against his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I need to tell you how impressed I've been with your work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every year I go to Fashion Week in Paris. It's dazzling. The photo shoots... the parties... that incredible runway. When the first model bursts through the curtain and hits that catwalk? Sara, a roar goes up from that crowd that's like... nothing you've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The college allows me to take one student. All expenses paid.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR ROBERTS, (CONT-D)
dialogues.text: Full backstage access. Usually, it's a senior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it doesn't have to be. Sara's pulse is racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I understand. Are you saying what I think you're saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying you have a shot. You'd have to earn it, Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I'll do... anything. Roberts stands and walks to the window. He looks out at t quad... and now turns back to Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see more danger in your work. Your designs are always crisp; they're always clear. But they're a little... safe. That stung. Sara can't keep the red from rising in her fa Roberts walks over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid to go to some of the... He delicately taps her temple.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR ROBERTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: darker places in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... He squats beside her, his hand on her shoulder now. He lo into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best designers push the boundaries of what's... acceptable. They take chances. Do you like to take chances, Sara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. He kisses her. Sara pushes him away, jumping out of her chair. She stands in front of him, shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you just did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took a chance, that's all. With a student that I trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go. Sara grabs her books. As she heads for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris, Sara. Fashion Week. Don't blow the chance of a lifetime. She hurries out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca sits alone at a study table. Sara walks up and dr down her books. THUD. Students look over from other table Sara doesn't care. She sits down and stares blankly into space, trying to forget what just happened. Rebecca leans over, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My design professor just kissed me. Rebecca turns very serious. She gets up and sits down nex to Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? Sara nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it just really creeped me out. And I think the asshole's married.
Rebecca puts her hand on Sara's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Roberts at his desk, set to call it a day. He tosses some design sheets into his briefcase. He opens a desk drawer... grabs his wedding ring... and s it onto his finger. He hears FOOTSTEPS in the hallway. The sexy, unmistakable clicking of a woman's heels. They come closer... and now at his door. Roberts watches the door, waiting for a knock. Nothing. H walks to it. He can see the silhouette of two feet at the bottom of the door. He smiles -- Sara, coming back to him He opens the door, revealing: Rebecca. She wears a snug v-neck cardigan, skin-tight bla jeans, and silver stiletto heels. A small purse on her shoulder. Roberts swallows his surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Roberts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad I caught you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was just... But Rebecca steps past him into the office, her heels snapping on the worn hardwood floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts, a little annoyed but also intrigued, follows her back inside. They face each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not one of my students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. That's why I'm here.
She steps to his desk and leans against it. Her cool mann is disarming. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm failing Intro Pysch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm bored. I thought it would be all about Freud, and deep dark secrets. But it's brain chemistry. Synapses. I can't stay awake in class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that. But I'm not sure what I can do to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's the last day to drop a course without penalty. Unless I can add another one in its place, I'll fall way behind in credits. Daddy won't take that very well. He might even pull the plug. Which means...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty much at your mercy, Professor. Roberts smiles. This girl is a trip. Is she for real? She so calm, so steady. Roberts can't get a handle on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've always made it a policy not to accept any students this late in the term.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like just any student to you? She smiles... and eases up onto his desk. Facing him. Pre feet dangling, ankles locked. Jesus. She eases her purse off her shoulder and onto the desk. S sees the framed picture of a WOMAN AND TWO KIDS. She pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife is very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex-wife . The game is on now. Roberts slowly walks around the desk, until he's behind Rebecca. In the picture frame's reflection, Rebecca sees him slip his wedding ring. He palms it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few things I'd need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me anything. He's circling the desk now. Predator and prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any design experience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I definitely look better out of them than in them. What an answer. Roberts stops in front of her. He moves i close, between her parting legs. He looks into her eyes. Still steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we might be able to work something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it from there.
He kisses her. She opens her lips for a tantalizing secon and now gently pushes him away. He holds his ground. He's a taste -- he wants a lot more. Suddenly, Rebecca's face hardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! You're hurting me! Professor, stop!... Roberts stares at her in shock. He's not even touching he What's going on? Rebecca smiles again. This girl is whacked. But damn, Roberts wants her. And he eyes are inviting him back. As he presses in to kiss her again... She rockets a knee into his groin and he crumples to the floor, gasping for air. He drops his wedding ring, which rolls away across the floor. Rebecca steps to the desk, where her purse sits open. We see the Walkman inside. She takes it out. Smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birthday gift. You should get one, they're great. She slips on the earbuds... plays with the Walkman for a seconds... and now hits the play button. We hear their pr conversation, played back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me. I'll take it from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owl You're hurting me! Professor, stop!... Rage and betrayal in Roberts' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bitch tease!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not teasing. She starts to circle him now, as he writhes in pain on th floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see enough danger in me now, Professor? Did I go to a dark enough place for you? He recognizes his own words to Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? How did?... Who are you? He lunges at her ankle. She steps out of his grasp... and slams the sharp spike of her heel down on his hand. He ye again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trusted you. She walks toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't do this. Twenty years. Everything I worked for. I'll pay for that tape. Rebecca stops at the door. She kneels, picks up his weddi ring, and rolls it across the floor to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you will. She walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara sits on Stephen's bed. She is looking out the window holding a theory book in her hand. Stephen watches her from his side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything wrong? Sara is taken out of her own world

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.
She smiles. Stephen smiles back. Sara looks down in her book again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara looks up at the building. She sighs before she enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks slowly toward the classroom, letting other stud pass her. She steps into the doorway and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN, standing at Professor Roberts' podium. She gestu for everyone to come in. Sara, like the rest, is confused

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome. I'm Professor Jacobs. I'll be taking over the class for the rest of the semester. Sara can't believe it. She takes a seat and turns to the STUDENT next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks in with a tray, still a bit dazed. She sees a dozen hallmates milling about and Rebecca sitting by hers in the corner, drawing. Sara joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what I told you about Professor Roberts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're calling it a leave of absence. But what I heard... someone sent the dean an anonymous recording of him hitting on another student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's called Karma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara serves up two fresh lattes... and now leans against counter to watch the band. Stephen's band. He catches her looking at him. She smiles. Seriously smitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen, sweaty, is behind the counter helping Sara clean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made a decision. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna quit the band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Really? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a waste of time-and we suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me think about this. The only places we can get booked is at my own frat house and at my girlfriend's coffee shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. You guys do suck. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. Did you just say girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think it'll be fun to stay here during Thanksgiving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner at the frat, the football games. Don't forget the always awkward, homoerotic humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. For sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A somber Rebecca stares at herself in the full-length mir on the back of the front door. A very strange expression her eyes. She looks herself over, makes a fist, and now.. Punches herself on the temple. Hard. She staggers, nearly knocked out. She straightens. Looks in the mirror. Her sk is already bruising. She punches herself again. Same spot And again, with her other fist this time. And now a shot her shoulder. And another. It's painful to watch. But she getting more and more numb to the blows. She inspects herself closely... and now reaches down and grabs an artist's UTILITY KNIFE. It looks like a large, retractable box cutter. She extends the blade all the way out. She pulls up her shirt. Turns to the side a bit. Pla the knife against her skin and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara opens the door and finds Rebecca curled up in a feta position in a corner of the room. Sobbing. Sara drops her things and runs over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. What happened? She cradles Rebecca, who buries her head in between her knees. Sara checks the bruises on her head and arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca. It's okay. You're safe now. Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking for Cuddles. A man... pulled me into an alley. He tried... Sara holds her. She can't finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's okay. Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alright now. Sara notices a streak of blood against Rebecca's shirt. S pulls it up and sees a slash. Gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, newly showered, hair still wet, sits on her bed her underwear. Sara is tending to her wounds. Ice for the bruises. Disinfectant for the cut. Rebecca flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not deep, thank God. But you should see a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, you need to. And then the police.
Rebecca pulls back on her bed, ruining the gauze job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to. I can't. Sara pulls out her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're calling them, or I am. There's a psycho walking around this campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I didn't see him. She's so frazzled, she's undoing Sara's nursing efforts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I won't call. Just let me help you. Rebecca calms down. Let's Sara finish. Watching her inten as she works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara's on the sidewalk in front of her dorm with Stephen. Inside, the lobby is busy with students getting ready to home for the holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about not staying. But, Rebecca...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make out with my pillow and pretend it's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just say you'll miss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss you. Rebecca pulls up in her car. Sara gets in. Rebecca gives Stephen an "I win" look as Sara closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara looks down at her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't heard from Jason in weeks. It's weird how he just stopped calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what you wanted, right? Sara nods, reassuring herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah it is. Sara looks out the window. Rebecca shows a hint of a smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca's car pulls up to the iron gates of a huge mansio that could be straight out of Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca and Sara stand in the driveway, looking up at the mansion. Sara is in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my parents house. It was never a home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca and Sara walk in. Rebecca's on edge, flinching as Sara closes the door. Rebecca's parents rush in from the living room. Her fathe gives her an awkward hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't think you would make it.
Her mother sees the bruises on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing? This isn't nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it alone. Sara is stunned. But Rebecca's parents cease. Her mom giv her a tender, protracted embrace. Rebecca endures it, bar raising her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sara. She puts out her hand, but cuts Rebecca a look. You didn' tell them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara's my roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jeff. Rebecca's mother comes over and unexpectedly embraces Sar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so great to meet you, Sara. I'm Alison. Rebecca grabs Sara by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let me show you my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca slams the door behind them, startling Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell them we were coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't need to know. Rebecca plops down on the bed. Sara looks around. It's a typical teenage girl's bedroom. Except, no posters. Just drawings covering the walls. The drawings are of teenage girls -- more precisely, they're different drawings of on teenage girl. They're odd, but compelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, some of my high school work. I haven't gotten around to takin them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family and guest sit around a very nice, but not too larg dining table. The contents of the house are expensive but not pretentious. Rebecca plays with her food, clearly not wanting to engag her parents, who are undaunted. All smiles and warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca's a pretty great artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we think Rebecca is so talented. Rebecca shakes her head, uncomfortable with the flattery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's an awesome roommate, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at his daughter,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice to hear and I'm sure she likes you because she never brings anyone home before. Rebecca stares at her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? As a parent you worry. You protect your daughter all her life and then she goes off to college and she's on her own. I'm just relieved she got a good roommate. Sara cuts discreet looks around the table. Who are these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, I'll make up a room for you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll stay in my room. Sara turns to Rebecca, confused but willing to go along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Rebecca are getting ready to sleep. Sara has mad makeshift bed in the middle of the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can share the bed if you want. Sara looks down at her own "bed" and takes a glance at th walls. On the floor, she's going to be surrounded by the drawings of Rebecca looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Sara climbs into bed with Rebecca. They lay back to back. Rebecca turns the lamp off next to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next Thanksgiving, you can run interference with my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Sara closes her eyes. It's silent. Rebecca turns over. A beat. She opens her eyes -- just inches from Sara. She ev so slowly raises her hand and gently strokes Sara's hair.
Sara opens her eyes for a second. Not sure if she felt something. She closes them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff walks from the stairs into the pitch black kitchen. lived here long enough to know his way in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff opens the fridge. The soft light barely illuminates Rebecca, sitting stoically at the table behind her father Jeff jumps. He recovers, standing by the open fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becs. You scared me. Rebecca, glass of milk in her hand, gives her father a di look. We know how much she hates nicknames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara wakes up alone in bed. She can hear soft voices from downstairs. She climbs out of bed and walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara stands at the top of the stairs. She walks down them to the kitchen doorway. She peeks inside to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca and her father sitting at the table. Just the moonlight through the window falling over them. Spooky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. My grades are good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant. She looks down at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making friends. Jeff, very subtly, cringes. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, look at me for a second. Now she looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother and I are very fond of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. He doesn't know what else to say. Outside Sara sees the framed photos on the wall. Each features Rebecca's parents in some exotic locale: On beach... on the ski slopes... on a cruise ship. They smil happily at the camera. Rebecca isn't in a single picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to make sure. Good night, I'm heading back to bed. He rises. Sara turns and walks up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara waits by the front door. Alison walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Rebecca's going to show me some of her high school hangouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Alison peers up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca seems to be doing well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh, yeah. I think she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she taking her medication?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medication? Alison turns to see... her daughter at the top of the sta Did she hear them? She walks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey sweetheart. She kisses her on the cheek. Rebecca is annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? Sara nods, but she's still reeling from Alison's words. Medication? She looks back, but Alison waves cheerfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a great time, you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an affluent but quaint little town's main street. Rebecca and Sara stroll down the sidewalk. Sara cuts discreet, sideways glances at Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's just... She wants to ask her about that medication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see where you come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COFFEE SHOP DAY
dialogues.text: Sara and Rebecca are in line for their drinks. The TEENAG CASHIER takes their money... but keeps staring at Rebecca She doesn't pay any attention to him. Sara takes her coff

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. The cashier stares at her, as if trying to figure Sara ou What's she doing with Rebecca? The girls sit at a table. The cashier and BARISTA keep glancing over, whispering to each other. Rebecca shoots t a look. Like a warning. They quiet. Start doing busy work

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to come here like every day after school. The door opens. THREE GIRLS walk in, laughing and chattin One BRUNETTE spots Rebecca and stops dead in her tracks. Sara recognizes her. It's MARIA, the girl from Rebecca's Facebook, and the subject of all those wall sketches. The chatting girls all fall silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They went to my high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends? Rebecca doesn't answer her. She's focused on making eye contact with the Brunette. The girls linger by the door, whispering among themselves Finally, the Brunette sits down at a table by the entranc As far away from Rebecca's and Sara's table as possible. The other two girls walk to the counter. They sneak glanc at Rebecca as they order their drinks. Sara looks back and forth between Rebecca and the girls. Rebecca doesn't waver. She keeps staring at the Brunette. Suddenly, Rebecca gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's leave. Rebecca walks towards the door. Sara, confused, gathers h things and gets up. Rebecca stops at the Brunette's table The Brunette sits there, like a deer caught in headlights

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Maria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. The other girls walk over. Rebecca, unfazed, looks them o sending shivers down their spines. They want to back up t friend, but they look as scared as she does. Sara watches this from a few feet away. Rebecca suddenly turns cheerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I wanted to introduce you to Sara. My roommate. Sara gives a small wave to Maria, who looks her over. Alm as if she feels sorry for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Rebecca keeps eyeing Maria, a superior grin on her face. awkward beat. Everyone's tense. Sara clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we better go. Rebecca snaps out of it. Nods. They start to walk out. Bu they open the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca. Everyone turns to Maria. She looks Rebecca in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were never friends. Rebecca stares at her, grinding her teeth. The tension building. Maria doesn't back down, though. She needed to this. Sara grabs Rebecca's shoulder, gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headed back to school. Sara looks out the window. Lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess college is a fresh start for both of us. Rebecca doesn't look at her. Just a hint of acknowledgeme on her face. Sara's phone buzzes. This gets Rebecca's attention. Sara looks at the text message she just received from Irene: "back in LA. lemme know abt movin in."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene's back in town. Sara types and sends a text back. Rebecca watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara's running through the quad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, coming in from a run, times it perfectly, sneaking the front door as a student walks out. She bypasses the elevator, heading straight to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bursts out the door and into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks in, still a bit out of breath. Rebecca is packi her back-pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Good run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between deep breaths) Great. You wanna go get dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the art studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Catch you later then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wait up, Sara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel inspired. She's out the door. Sara notices that Rebecca left her sketchpad behind on her bed. She eyes it for a beat. Look the closed door. As she steps toward the sketchpad... Rebecca charges back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgot my pad. She snags it from her bed and leaves. Sara eyes Rebecca's dresser. But first... She walks to the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara peeks her head out and looks down both sides of the empty hallway. She hears the elevator ding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara heads straight for Rebecca's dresser. A beat. Is she really going to do this? Yes. She slides open the top dra Supplies. The second drawer: sketchpads. She leafs throug them: Empty. She searches the third drawer: Sweaters. She feels around beneath them. Wait a minute. She pulls out: Two bottles of prescription medicine. "LITHIUM... For APD Both bottles are full of pills. As Sara stares at them... A HAND TAPS HER SHOULDER. She leaps out of her socks. But it's just Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your door was open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Sara grabs him and gives him a long hug. Stephen holds he tight and speaks, muffled by her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are those? A beat. Should she bring him into this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I intend to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca is standing up, back pack around her shoulder, he drawing pad in her other hand. Her arm is wrapped around pole for balance. She stares out the window. No emotion. looks like she's staring at her own reflection. The train comes to a halt. Riders shuffle around. Rebecca sees a seat open up and sits down. She opens her drawing pad and starts on a blank piece of paper. She loo up and we see what she's been staring at: Irene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Stephen stand at Sara's desk, over her computer. Sara googles "Lithium and APD", and clicks on an entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APD -- anti-social personality disorder. Also known as sociopathy. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. I thought she was just weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says lithium can control the condition. (nodding at the bottles) Maybe these are refills. Maybe she's been taking it all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly doesn't seem like she's been taking them. He's right and she knows it. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time I moved in with Irene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stylish, hip night club. A sophisticated crowd. Irene a three FRIENDS sit in the lounge section, sipping exotic martinis and watching the dance floor. And on that dance floor one particular woman dances by herself, lost in the music, oblivious to everything aroun her. She turns as she dances and we see that it's Rebecca Irene gets up and heads towards the bathroom. As she wind her away around the borders of the dance floor, she notic Rebecca. She pauses to watch her. THEIR EYES MEET FOR MOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene stands at the mirror, fixing her make-up. The door opens and closes. She glances over to see Rebecca walking Rebecca steps to the sink, just a few feet down from Iren She's out of breath, a sexy sheen of sweat on her arms. Irene breaks out a tube of lip gloss. Rebecca is watching in the mirror, and Irene knows it. She applies the gloss smiles at the little kick it gives her. Her eyes find Rebecca's in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to stare, but you are so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. So are you. Great lips. What kind is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cinnamon. Caffeinated. A girl never knows how late she's gonna party. Rebecca smiles. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I try it? Irene hands her the lip gloss... Rebecca takes her hand a pulls her close. She kisses Irene full on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right... cinnamon. Irene smiles. This room's heating up fast. Irene's eyes meet Rebecca's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we get out of here. I'd invite you to my place, but I have a roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As luck would have it, I'm only two blocks away and...no roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An alarm clock buzzes with no effect to Irene who is dead the world. She grunts and finally opens her eyes. She wip the sleep from her eyes, she looks around confused, looks the empty side of her bed where someone had obviously spe the night. Irene sits up and turns off the alarm..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. She looks at an empty glass on her bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene get's up with the empty glass in her hand. She stumbles out into the... HALLWAY. She staggers to keep her balance on her way to the kitche We stay in the hallway as Irene enters in the kitchen and switches on the light.

We can see her shadow in the hallway and hear Irene fill glass. It's quiet for a moment. She drinks. She fills the glass again. Irene comes back into the hallway with glass in hand. She switches off the light in the kitchen. But as she starts go back to her room ...WHAM!! Rebecca charges out of nowhere and crashes into Irene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara is going for a run through the city. She stops at an art deco apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara spots Irene's name on the buzzer and calls up. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks out the door. Looks around. And takes off runni again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, hands on hips, walks down the hallway and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds Rebecca, sitting on her bed. Drawing. She light when she sees Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey yourself. Where were you all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I got inspired. I just lost track of time. Sara pulls off her sweaty top and throws it in the hamper grabbing a towel. She's wearing a sportsbra, revealing he tattoo. Sara grabs a robe. A beat. She's nervous, but she needs to do this. Time for "big talk." She sits on her bed and faces Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. It would mean a lot to me. I won't be able to do it without you. Sara looks into her plaintive eyes. So much want in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... sure. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls walk along the wall, checking out the samples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't rush this, Rebecca. We can always come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm out here if you need me. Sara sits down as the TATTOO ARTIST escorts Rebecca upsta She looks giddy and nervous. Sara waves. When she's gone, Sara takes out her phone and texts Irene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, bored, leafs through a tattoo magazine for the 100t time. Her phone buzzes. A response from Irene: "outta town for a gig. will call when back ; )" Sara's relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca walks slowly down the stairs. Wincing in pain. Sa puts the phone back in her pocket and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see it. Rebecca pulls down the collar of her shirt to reveal, jus under her collarbone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, stunned speechless, starts backing away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of me as your sister. Rebecca is oblivious to the rage building in Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want... you can call me Emily. Sara clenches her fists. She's shaking with rage. She mov toward Rebecca, whose grin fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Sara steps up to her, inches away, ready to beat the shit of her. And Rebecca can't believe it. She's that far gone Her eyes search Sara's for an answer. Sara abruptly turns and walks out the door. Rebecca watch her leave through the front window. Sara never looks back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. Sara, emotionally exhausted, ste out, carrying a box of her things. Stephen waits by the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all you're taking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the rest of my things when Irene comes back to town. He takes the box. Then notices --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your necklace? She instinctively rubs the base of her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find it. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going back up there. He hands her the box. Time to man up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here. I'll go look for it. She kisses him tenderly, unbelievably appreciative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks out to the cab. Pauses. She's tempted to look at her dorm room window... but she doesn't. Good thing, too. Rebecca sits on the ledge, looking down. Her face is blank. Not hurt, not angry -- completely blan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca still sits at the window. She holds her camera up taking a picture down below. She turns as Stephen enters. She puts the camera down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Sara's necklace? Rebecca solemnly shakes her head. He looks around the dresser. In the drawers. Flips over Sara's pillow. Rebecc watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do? He stops searching. Looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just needs to move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you? He doesn't answer. He keeps searching... but he can feel Rebecca's eyes on him now. Creepy. He gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do find it, can you let me know? Instead of answering, Rebecca raises her camera and takes picture. Stephen stares at her, unnerved. He finally snap out of it and walks out the door. She watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara is cleaning, trying to make a dent in a world-class mess. She doesn't mind -- a big weight's off her shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should call someone. The dean's office. Or at least your R.A. She keeps cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tell them what? What has she really done to me? No one can do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the weirdest thing, Stephen. The girl's own parents are afraid of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she sure scared the shit out of me. Sara really wants to change the subject. She holds up two his t-shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these dirty or clean? Stephen sniffs the shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in between. She throws the t-shirts at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara heads to class, walking faster than usual. Bumping i people as she looks around, making sure she'll spot Rebec before Rebecca spots her. She makes it to the front door of the building. She looks back at the quads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara locks the front door and heads back home. She walks down an empty quad. She slows at the sight of.. Rebecca. Walking directly towards her from the other end the quad. No one else is in sight. Sara thinks about veering off to side. No. She can do this. She walks straight ahead. Rebe keeps her pace; hooded sweater up, looking down at the pavement, listening to her Walkman. Sara takes a deep breath as they get closer to each other preparing herself for the confrontation. Ten feet away no Five... But Rebecca passes her without looking. Sara walks a litt further and turns around. Rebecca keeps walking. Did she even see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara hurries up the stairs to the fraternity house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara reaches Psi U. and closes the door behind her. She l around at the messy first floor. At the PACK OF GUYS in t living room, yelling at the hoops game on TV. Sara smiles. She's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca is alone, with just a crack of light coming from open door to the hallway. She's sketching, still wearing Walkman. Hundreds of sheets of paper are scattered around floor, but we can't see what she's drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara is trying to study at a cramped desk but the music f outside the room is too loud. Stephen is on the bed, reading. He's used to it. She hears a loud commotion from the hallway. Frustrated, she gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a couple of guys playing nerf basketball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. Is it a game to be as loud as you possibly can? She waves her arms like a crazy person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many walls can you possibly bump into!? They just return blank stares. She slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara tries to study while the fraternity brothers continu shout down the hall. Stephen eyes her warily. Her cellpho rings. She pulls it out of the purse: Jason.
She hesitates... and now stuffs the phone back in her bag she gets up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm going to hit the library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can walk you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party starts at ten. Really cool band...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the drummer's really hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may be, but I'm sleeping with his girlfriend... She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASON, a handsome all-American Midwestern kid, stands in front of Sara's dorm. He's talking into his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara. I'm actually... I'm in front of your dorm. I just flew in. I'm at the Roosevelt Hotel, room 210. Call me, okay? He hangs up. Some students leave the dorm and he grabs th door before it closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca kneels down in front of her dresser. Opens the bo drawer. Her sweaters. She fishes underneath them. Pulls o her lithium pills. But just looks at them. Anger in her e She puts the bottle back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason walks through the hallway, checking the numbers on doors. He stops in front of Sara's room. Knocks lightly o the door. No answer. Knocks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca sits back into Sara's chair, staring at the door, ignoring the knocks. Almost catatonic. Her right hand slowly drags a utility knife over the armr shredding it to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason writes a note. He folds it and slides it under the door. He hesitates for a second, hoping this is the right thing to do, then walks back down the hallway towards the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca stares at the note for a moment. She walks to the door, picks it up and begins to read Jason's note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you won't take my calls, but I'm here and I just w to see you. I'm at The Roosevelt Hotel, Room 210, until.. however long it takes. Please. Love,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca crumples up the paper and throws it in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca lets the water soak her. Eyes open. She runs her fingers through her now long dark brown hair. Black water trickles down her legs and puddles near the drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca stands naked in front of the mirror, staring at h reflection. She then digs into her bag and pulls out a lo pair of shears. Her "Emily" tattoo is starting to heal. S gently traces the letters with the sharp tips of the shea still looking at it in the mirror. She lifts the shears and starts cutting her hair shorter. Just above her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca walks over to Sara's closet. She opens it and thu through some of the clothes that Sara left behind. She pu out a dress. Holds it in front of herself as she stands i front of the mirror. Nice -- but something's missing. Rebecca goes to her drawer and pulls out Sara's silver ch Which she caresses in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara's kicked her feet on the table, reading a book. Enjoying the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raucous party in full swing. Stephen's band has just finished playing and he's walking off the cheap stage. A GIRL smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me find the keg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I have to go look for my girlfriend anyway. She walks away. "Jerk". He grins... and now checks his wa Where's Sara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens, revealing Rebecca. Or is it Sara The hair. The dress. The tattoo. Rebecca looks just like

As she steps into the hallway, she gently fingers the necklace. She walks along, looking at the room numbers. She stops in front of a room. She's about to knock... but sees a housekeeping cart a few doors down, in front of an open room. She walks to the cart. She peeks inside the room... and n plucks the master key card off the cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, shirtless, sleeps on his stomach in bed. The front door clicks and slowly creaks open just enough a silhouette of a woman to appear. She closes the door. J barely acknowledges the noise in his sleep. Rebecca walks to the bed in the soft moonlight. She stare down at Jason. She slips off her dress, which falls to th floor. She's in just bra and panties now. She climbs onto the bed beside Jason. He starts awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. She crawls onto him, not letting him turn over. She start kissing the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got my voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmmm. Kissing his back now, moving lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, Sara. Oh, that feels good. She works her way back up to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn over.
Did that sound like Sara? But as Jason turns over, he see The hair. The necklace. That unmistakable "Emily" tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes. He does. She reaches beneath the blanket, and does what s needs to. She settles onto him. And now starts to move. And as she moves we go behind her and see, shining in the light, the utility knife beneath her bra strap. Flat agai the skin of her back. Jason lies still, eyes clenched shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Sara. She lets him have one, two, three seconds of heaven. Her hands reach behind her and ease out the utility knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she doesn't love you. Jason's eyes fly open. That wasn't Sara's voice. And thos aren't Sara's eyes boring into his. Rebecca leans down, her face to his. Jason's eyes widen i shock, horror, and now pain as her unseen hands drive the knife deep into his gut. He gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hurt her. She kisses him -- the last thing he'll ever feel. He shudders, trembles, and lies still, eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara's still reading. A hand touches her shoulder. She ju but it's just the LIBRARIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're about to close. Sara can't believe it's so late. She puts her things away Grabs her phone to check the time, distracted by the "1 n voicemail" message. She's about to press the voicemail button... But a text comes in from Irene:
"Im back. Get your butt over here, I've got another surpr for you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen walks around, beer-less, searching the crowd for Sara. He checks his watch. Pats his pocket -- no cell pho He heads up the stairs and into his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen picks his phone off the dresser. Sees he has a ne voicemail from Sara. He plays the message

dialogues.speaker: SARA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hi Stephen, it's me. I'm stopping by Irene's, come on by. I want you guys to meet ...it's on 524 South Grand, Apt. 708. Love you. He groans. A sharp knock, and the bedroom door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands on deck -- the keg's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara comes fast-paced down the sidewalk. She enters Irene building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara rides up the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara walks to the door of Irene's apartment. It's open bu there's not a sound. No music, no cocktail chatter. She checks the apartment number again. It's the right one She knocks lightly. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara steps into the foyer.
She walks down the long entryway into a newly-renovated living room. Dark and empty. Sara's starting to feel unea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene? There's a bedroom dead ahead. Warm light pours out. She slowly walks to the open door... looks in... and freezes. CLOSE ON SARA'S EYES. Horror-stricken by what she sees. The bedroom is dark, except for the single lamp, above... Irene. She lies on the bed, each of her wrists cuffed to bedpost. A red Hermes scarf is stuffed in her mouth. Sara can't move. She stares at Irene in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene. Irene mumbles, her eyes wide open in terror. As Sara star toward Irene...

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Some role model she turned out to be. Couldn't even take care of herself. Rebecca steps out of the darkness, a gun in her hand. Sar drops her phone on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca! Rebecca holds the gun steady on Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down and shut up. Sara lowers herself into a black chair, her eyes on Irene Rebecca picks up Sara's cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. All I ever wanted was to be your friend. A beat. Sara knows she has to play this just right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, you are my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Shut up. We're not friends. We're here because you betrayed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, I'm sorry--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. Stop saying things you don't mean. I protected you. From that whore Tracy and that nasty little kitten... and That scumbag of a professor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even that loser ex-boyfriend of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? What'd you do to them? What'd you do to Jason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got rid of them all. And how do you repay me? By leaving me. Sara sinks out of the chair onto her knees in astonishmen She looks at Irene. Sara digs deep... lifts up her face... and looks Rebecca the eye. She puts everything she has into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, please forgive me. A long beat. Rebecca's face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can start all over again. Let's make things the way they were, Sara. That first day. Just the two of us. Sara sees Rebecca start to twist a garbage bag in her han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all... you can only have one best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Don't! Rebecca whips the bag around Irene's head. Irene starts t buck and thrash. But it doesn't help her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay still bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Don't do this... Sara stands. She stares at Irene. She can't watch her die She walks toward the bed, ignoring Rebecca's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! I mean it. Rebecca raises the gun to Sara's face but Sara keeps comi Rebecca realizes she can't stop Sara. She cracks Sara acr the temple with the gun-butt, knocking her to the floor. She kneels down beside Sara. Worried... clearing the hair from Sara's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh... I'm so sorry. Sara backhands her, knocking the gun out of her hand. It skitters across the floor and out the door into the livin room. Sara stands up first and dives for the bed, but Rebecca g Sara by the neck and rips her off the bed. She puts her i chokehold. Sara backs Rebecca into the wall, trying to loosen the chokehold. She slams her back against the wall. And again Sara smashes her elbow into Rebecca's jaw, breaking her g She heads for the door, but Rebecca trips her. As Sara rises... Rebecca knees her in her stomach, knocking the wind out o her. As Sara gasps for breath... Rebecca races out into the living room for the gun. Sara gets up quickly and slams the door shut and locks it Rebecca turns around and goes for the door.
Sara goes to the bed and rips open the garbage bag on Ire head. IRENE'S EYES POP OPEN. Huge relief in Sara's face. But... Rebecca bangs the door.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't do this Sara!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara takes the scarf out of Irene's mouth and pulls again the steel handcuffs. Useless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca wipes blood off her lip and leans up to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me hurt you, Sara. I just want to be your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Irene are frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My phone. My phone. She nods her head and Sara sees the phone on the bed tabl She rushes for it. No good the wire is cut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window! There's a fire escape. You can reach it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca looks around for the gun. Throwing chairs and furniture around. She finds it. Picks the gun off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara races to the window and throws it open. There's just empty street below. She eyes the fire escape. A nearly impossible leap away. But Sara's out of options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara takes a tentative step out onto the slim ledge. Her hits a flowerpot, which plummets ten stories... and smash to pieces in the alley. Sara shuts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, back at the bedroom door, raises the gun and fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door shatters, and the bullet continues straight ahea and tears a pillow open, just beside Irene's head. Feathe go flying. Irene screams. Rebecca kicks the door open and steps in, gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're scared, Sara. But I promise, everything is gonna be okay. She stops short at the sight of...Sara on the ledge. Rebecca turns and stares at Irene. Fresh panic rising in Irene's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Irene. But she's my friend, not yours. She raises the gun at the helpless Irene... But out of nowhere STEPHEN, RUSHING UP FROM BEHIND, knock her arm. The gun fires wildly, one bullet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exploding through the window, shattering it and startling Sara, who loses her balance and slips off the ledge. She grabs on by her fingertips, her face hitting the brick wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohgodohgodohgod. The more she screams, the more she loses her grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca fires another shot, hitting a giant bedroom mirro shattering it's reflection of Rebecca's struggle with Stephen. Rebecca slams her head into his lip, knocking him backwar He keeps hold of her, and they hit the floor, the gun fly out of Rebecca's hand. Stephen gets on top. He lifts his arm high and balls his before he puts it right in her face full throttle, knocki her out cold. He quickly takes the gun and puts it inside his belt as h races for the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!! He sees Sara dangling outside and reaches for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara's crying, barely mouthing Stephen's name. He grabs h arms. Leaning halfway outside, he starts to pull her up. Part of the way up, he holds her against his chest and le her cry. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay I've got you. Everything is gonna be okay! He pulls her halfway in the window... But a shadow rises behind him.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: A loud unpleasant sound. THUD! Irene screams. Then Stephen stiffens, his body straightening in shock. Something's wrong. And now Sara stares in horror as... Blood runs down his face. He looks into Sara's eyes... an lets go of her.

She falls, but manages to hook onto the ledge as Stephen disappears from the window frame. Using the brick wall fo leverage, she arduously lifts herself up into the window time to see... Stephen, glassy-eyed, backing away from the window. He sl to the floor, revealing: Rebecca. She's a crazed mess, hair and eyes wild. Rebecca drops the bloody fireplace poker and rushes to th window. She helps Sara in. They tumble onto the floor. Sara tosses Rebecca to the side and rushes over to Stephe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen. Stephen is out. She sees the gun in his belt. She pulls i out, spins, and levels it at Rebecca. The gun shakes violently in her hand. Rebecca stands and walks calmly towards Sara, who is stil the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't do it. We're fr-- Sara pulls the trigger. Click. Rebecca stares in shock. Click. Click. Click. Click. Sara closes her eyes in frustration. She drops the gun. Tears stream down Rebecca's face. She can't believe Sara pulled that trigger. But as if flipping a switch... Rebecca's sadness turns to rage. She balls her fists, her knuckles white, and... CHARGES at Sara full force, slamming her against the wall She tosses her like a ragdoll across the room, where... Sara's head slams the nightstand, knocking the contents o Rebecca's purse everywhere. Rebecca wipes the tears from her eyes. It hurts her to hu Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends help each other. They take care of each other. Sara, dazed and weak, stares at Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca. We were never friends. That's the last straw. Rebecca comes hard, murder in her eyes. She grabs Sara around the throat, pulls her up from the floor, and slams her against the wall. She starts choking the life out of her. Sara's face turns red. Redder... But suddenly Rebecca's grip loosens. Her eyes stare in sh Sara pulls Rebecca's hands off her neck with one hand. Th utility knife is in her other hand... stuck between Rebec shoulder blades. Rebecca falls to the floor, bringing Sara down with her. won't let go of Sara. As she gasps for air, she sees... Sara's tattoo, visible beneath her torn shirt. Sara self- consciously notices her looking at it. Rebecca reaches ou and grabs Sara's hand. Sara lets go of her hand, and removes the necklace from around Rebecca's neck. Irene is trembling in the bed. Too shocked to say anythin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara. She races over to him. He's barely alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen. Hold on. She finds her phone on the floor. She steps back to Steph and cradles his head in her lap as she dials 911. He looks into her eyes and smiles. She smiles through her tears, love in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a warm, spring day. Sara, melancholy but looking in much better shape since the last time we saw her, stands front of her dorm, looking to restart her college career. She plays with the silver chain once again around her nec
She opens the front door and walks in. Students milling a look at her. Know who she is. We see Kim and Tracy. They don't say anything. Don't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara opens the door. The simple room is identical to her previous one. She hesitates at first but then walks in. There is a box marked "SARA" filled with the things she l behind in her old dorm. There's a knock on the open door.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How are you feeling? Stephen enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better now. You being here's gonna help. Sara smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's moving in going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let me give you some time to get settled in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I need you right here, right now. Stephen grins. He likes where this is headed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and Stephen push the twin bed into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't exactly what I had in mind. Sara grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I can get settled in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back to pick you up for dinner. You gonna be ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Stephen takes off down the hall. Sara follows him with he eyes before she goes back into her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara sits down on her bed. She watches the empty space wh the other bed used to be. She just stares at it. The came slowly tracks sideways until we see the side of the books where unseen by Sara, there's a flyer hung with a picture Richard Prince's Nurse of Greenmeadow announcing an upcom gallery exhibition.
